episode_title: 502 - The One With All The Kissing

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s Bathroom, Chandler and Monica are sharing a candlelight bubble bath while drinking champagne and they clink their glasses.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You look cute in bubbles.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ehh, you’re just liquored up.
(They move into kiss but are interrupted by Joey knocking on the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s me! I’m comin’ in!
(Monica quickly dives under the water as Joey enters. He looks a little shocked at what Chandler’s doing.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ve had a very long, hard day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, I’m gonna go get some chicken. Want some?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, no thanks. No chicken, bye-bye then.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.
(Joey turns to leave but stops at the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You sure? Some extra crispy? Dirty rice? Beans?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: For the last time no! Get out! Get out, Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!
(Joey leaves and Monica comes up for air.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you okay? I’m so sorry, he wouldn’t leave. He kept asking me about chicken.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chicken? I could eat some chicken.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Joe!
(Monica goes back underwater as Joey re-enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, can I get a 3-piece, some cole slaw, some beans, and a Coke-(Yelps in
pain as Monica grabs him underwater)-Diet Coke.
(Joey gives him a thumbs up and heads for the chicken.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mornin’ Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have to tell you this story. Okay, I was coming over here and this driver…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Was his name Angus? (Monica and Chandler laugh.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, he was this cab driver we had in London.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Ha-ha-ha. All right, anyway…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, what that place, that pub he took us too?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, The Wheatsheaf.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah-yeah, and they had that beer! That uh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bodington’s!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bodington’s! Woohoo! (And they all high-five each other.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh! Ahh, Pheebs, was gonna tell a story.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, so, he had a really funny hat—I don’t want to talk about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Ross, Bodington’s!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! (They high-five.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That was good beer.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, I’d walk back to London for another frosty one of those bad boys.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, I think they have those at that British pub near the trade center.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Later! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Isn’t Rachel supposed to be back by now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but her plane got delayed in Athens. But actually, (Checks watch) she should be here by now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, so-so you talked to her. Did she, did she sound mad?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, but she likes me. You abandoned her on a plane to Greece.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I did not abandon Rachel! Okay? Emily showed up at the airport! I had to go after her! I mean, I-I did what I had to do! She’s my wife! Rachel is my wife! Y’know— Emily ! Emily, is my wife! Man, what is that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you still hadn’t heard from Emily?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, not since I lost her at the airport.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe she can out run you man!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: HEY, SHE’s FAST!! OKAY?!! (Chandler is so shocked at Ross’s outburst that he drops his spoon and backs up) Oh! You-you think you can be beat me? Let’s go! Outside!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey! (They all go hug her, except for Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, Rach, I am so sorry. I am so-so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, come on! You just did what you had to do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s it? You’re not mad? I mean, it must’ve been terrible.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Terrible? Hell, I was in Greece! That was a nice hotel! Nice beach, met the nice people. Not to shabby for Rachel. (Goes and puts her luggage away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, what? That’s it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, yeah! We’re cool. Totally cool.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thanks. Oh, you’re the best. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, you’re the best.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, I gotta go to the flower store! (Runs to the door.) Check it out, no one will tell me where Emily is, so I’m gonna send 72 long-stem, red roses to Emily’s parent’s house, one for each day that I’ve known and loved her. That oughta get her talking to me again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, Ross, when you make out card; be sure to make it out to, EM-I-LY.
(Ross bangs his fists together to tell Chandler off, like what was learned last season. Read about it here.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, that’s great! It’s so good that you had a good time in Greece!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! I didn’t have a good time in Greece! Ross abandoned me! Okay, I couldn’t get a plane out, so I had to stay in their honeymoon suite with people coming up to me all the time going, “Oh, Mrs. Geller, why are you crying?” I mean, it was sooo humiliating. I felt like such an idiot! I mean, it’s all my fault! And you know why, because I make very bad decisions.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s not true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes it is! It is true! I went, I went after Ross in stupid London.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: London is stupid! Stupid!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, you were right. I should’ve never gone to London, and from now on you make all of my decisions for me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh… No, I did that for someone once and I’m not comfortable having that kind of power and control over someone’s life.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll do it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s fine. So Monica, you are now in control of my love life.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I gotta go to work.

(He gets up and gives Monica a rather passionate kiss as Rachel and Phoebe look on in amazement. After the kiss ends, Chandler suddenly realizes what he just did, so he decides to do something rather rash.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And uh, Rachel, glad to have you back.
(He goes over and gives Rachel the same treatment he gave Monica, only Rachel is shocked.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs! (He goes over and kisses Phoebe, who is also stunned.) Always a pleasure. (And he struts out leaving the girls to stare at each other.)

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Chandler and Joey are there looking at pictures from the trip to London.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Rachel, sweetie, look, here’s a really cute picture of Joey and you at the reception.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, he’s married! Ross is married. I can’t—I still can’t believe it. (Rachel grabs the picture from Monica)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, sweetie, by the edges.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, y’know I’m just gonna have to accept it (She grabs the rest of the pictures)…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh. (Monica covers her eyes in horror.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …I mean it’s my fault.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sweetie! Edges! Fingers! Smudgey! Pictures!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! (She licks the top picture and hands them back.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. That’s okay. I-I know that you’re very upset right now. I know, I know that wasn’t about me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I bet it was about her a little.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you would stop thinking about Ross for one minute you would notice that there are great guys everywhere! I mean, look! Look, Gunther! (Gunther turns to listen in.) I mean, he’s nice, he’s cute.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I guess Gunther is kinda…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, what about that guy over there? (She points at another guy and Gunther is deflated.) Remember? That is the guy you flirted with at the counter that time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. I don’t know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re going to talk to him! Y’know what? We made a deal, I make your decisions and I say you’re going to talk to him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, you’re the boss. I guess I gotta do what you tell me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Say that to him and you’re golden. (She just glares at him.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We got out pictures back from London. (Shows her one.) Here’s all of us at the Tower of London.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Here we all are! Yeah, there’s Ross and Joey and you and me. (She picks up a magic marker and draws herself in. Monica can’t watch.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, y’know what, we’ve been talking about London too much haven’t we?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. I’m sorry. It’s just ’cause I couldn’t be there. ’Cause all I ever get to do now is pregnant stuff, it just bums me out.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Sorry.
(Rachel returns.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know, a little of this, a little of that. Got myself a date tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See, didn’t I tell you?! You’re getting over Ross already!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well…
(Gunther goes up to the guy and holds a sign that reads, “We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone.”)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Get out!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler enters to find Monica waiting patiently for him. He closes the door and they start kissing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What took you so long?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got caught up and work, but I’m quitting tomorrow.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, good.
(They start kissing and turn around so that Chandler is facing the door. And Chandler sees Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey walk in and quickly ends the kiss with Monica.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, thanks for having me over! Rach. (Goes over, grabs her, and kisses her.) Pheebs. (After a moment while he decides how to kiss her around her belly, grabs her and kisses her.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See ya!! (To the girls.) What the hell was that?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Probably some y’know, European good-bye thing he picked up in London.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s not European!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it felt French.
(Joey is intrigued.)

content.description: The hallway between the apartments, Rachel is returning from her date with Dave.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, I really had a good time!

content.speaker: Dave
content.text: Yeah, me too. (They reach her door.) So, I guess this is it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Umm, unless you wanna come inside?

content.speaker: Dave
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Oh, uh, wait a minute, y’know what? I uh, I can’t decide this. Umm, okay, just hold on a second.

content.speaker: Dave
content.text: Okay, yeah!
(She enters the apartment, leaving Dave in the hallway, to find Ross sitting on the couch with a big box.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is Monica around? I-I have to ask her something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s doing her laundry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s that? (Points to the box.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It came in the mail today, it’s uh, 72 long-stemmed red roses, one for each day that I’ve known and loved Emily, cut up into mulch!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, honey that’s awful.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it’s not so bad. Monica’s gonna make potpourri! I think I’m gonna go wander out in the rain for a while.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But, it’s not raining.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t catch a break!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what Ross? You’re not going anywhere. You’re gonna sit right here. I’m gonna make you a cup of tea and we’re gonna talk this thing whole out. All right? (She goes out to talk to Dave) Hey, Dave!

content.speaker: Dave
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, listen, I’m gonna need to take a rain check, my roommate is just really sick. Okay? Bye! (She goes back in to talk to Ross.) Honey, listen, I know, I know things seem so bad right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach? Can I talk to for just a minute? I-I dropped some socks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. (She goes out to join her in the hall and starts looking for the dropped socks.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is the matter with you?! Do you want to fall into the trap? Do you want to fall into the trap?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! You did not drop any socks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just ran into Dave and he told me that you blew him off! I mean, you listen to me! Now, I’m calling the shots! I say you leave Ross alone and go get Dave! What the hell were you trying to do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, ultimately, I was trying y’know, I-I wanted…tell him y’know, that I’m still in love with him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!! You cannot tell him that!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? Why not?! People love to hear that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I make the decisions, and I say no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know what, no, you do not make my decisions because y’know what, you’re fired.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can’t fire me. I make your decisions and I say, “I’m not fired!” Ha!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well… (At a loss for words, she grabs some of Monica’s laundry and throws it on the floor as a diversion to allow Rachel to run back inside and close the door. Monica chases her to find that Rachel had locked the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel!! Come on! Let me in!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Havin’ some trouble?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel locked the door.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll kick that door in if you give me a little sugar.

content.description: The hallway, continued from earlier. Monica is still locked out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel! Let me in! Rachel!
[Cut to inside the apartment, Ross decides to let Monica in and goes over and opens the door in mid-pound.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. Rachel, can I talk to you outside for a sec?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I really need to talk to you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, then talk!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I will. Remember that thing that we just discussed that you wanted to do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, Rachel wants to take swing dance lessons. Which I think is a really stupid idea! It’s dangerous, she’s never gonna get what she wants, and who knows who she might (Turns to look at Ross) end up hurting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica’s right, swing dancing can be tricky. I’m gonna use the phone. I gotta cancel those five giant teddy bears I sent to Emily. (Looks at the rose mulch.) My God, think of the massacre.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m gonna do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, Rachel, I know-I know you think I’m crazy, please, before you tell him you love him, just-just try to find one person who thinks this is a good idea. Because I bet you, you can’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, fine.
(There’s a loud bang on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, I’m in!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Good deal.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Pheebs! Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, okay, Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, y’know how the other day you were talking about how you didn’t get to go to London and how you were kinda feeling left out?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, well, we felt really bad about that so we decided we should all take a little trip together!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, that’s so nice! How great! Well, where? Where’s the trip?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we thought we would all go to a picnic (Phoebe gasps), in Central Park!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Central …(not so excited) Park!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, all of us! All day!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That sucks! That’s not a trip! I just came from the park! What are we gonna high five about at the stupid Central Park? “Well, it’s right by my house, all right!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m gonna go home and bask in the triumph of my Central Park idea. (Gets up to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey-whoa-whoa-whoa!! Ho-ho-hold on a sec there, Mr. Kissey! Y’know, I’ve been meaning to talk to you about this whole, little, new European thing you got going on, and I just need to tell you that it makes me very uncomfortable and I just—y’know—stop it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was just trying to bring a little culture to the group.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s fine, just don’t bring it in my mouth.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Makes me wanna puke! (Chandler looks at her, quizzically.)

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel, Monica, Chandler, and Joey are there as Ross enters with Phoebe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey everybody, Pheebs is here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, woo!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, woo! Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, Pheebs, we decided the picnic idea was a little… Y’know, it didn’t have any… It-it, well it blew. So, we thought, that this afternoon that we would all go away for the whole weekend to, Atlantic City!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, Atlantic City! Oh, that’s a great plan! Who’s plan was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait! It was my plan.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo, I said we needed a new plan.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And, I came up with Atlantic City.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Which , is the new plan!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, well, why don’t we all meet upstairs in an hour?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! Ooh-ahh, I’m gonna go pack. I’m gonna go pack my ass off!
(They all go pack except for Ross.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Rach, let’s go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, y’know what? I’m-I’m gonna meet you upstairs in a minute.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Rachel, you didn’t find anyone so you can’t tell him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know what, that doesn’t matter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Rachel, do you have any idea how painful it is to tell someone that you love them and not have them say it back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I-I don’t care.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I-I can’t watch. (Leaves as sits down to read the paper.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What ‘cha readin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The paper.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, what’s it about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Events from around the globe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Uhh, Ross, y’know what, there’s something that I-that I have to talk to you about and everybody’s saying that I shouldn’t tell you, but I think they’re wrong. I mean, and you know how people can be wrong.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. Once, at work I-I thought carbon dating was fossilized…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Ross, I’m really trying to tell you something here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go ahead.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, okay, I think I’m-I’m just gonna-just gonna say it. Just gonna say it. Uhh, (pause) I’m still in love with you Ross.
(Ross is stunned.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow. Umm… Huh… I’m-I’m not sure what to do with that right now.
(Rachel starts laughing hysterically.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What? Was that a joke? ’Cause it’s mean.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so dead serious. I’m totally serious.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why are you laughing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because (laughs), because, I just heard it. I heard it, and it’s ridiculous! I mean, you’re married. You’re-you’re married and it’s just ridiculous, and it’s like, it’s like when said it, I sort of like, I floated up out of my body, y’know? And, and-and then I heard myself say it and then the floating Rachel (laughs) was like, “You are such an idiot!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, well I am married. Even though I haven’t spoken to my wife since the wedding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, that’s not funny.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, it kinda is. My wife won’t return my calls. I don’t know where my wife is. (Laughs) “Hey Ross, where’s the Mrs.?” Don’t know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, ohh, okay, y’know what, do you think ah, do you think that you just forget that I told you this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I kinda half to. I mean, because the thing is…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The thing is y’know, that you’re married to Emily.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is what the thing is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, things aren’t gonna be weird between us, right? I mean was that just the stupidest thing, me telling you that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No. No, I’m-I’m glad you did. Look, if nothing else, it’s-it’s always great when someone tells you they love you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s what I said! Thank you for being so nice. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No thank you for… Thank you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is about ready to leave for Atlantic City.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, let’s go!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Atlantic City!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Atlantic City, baby! Let’s roll some bones! Hey Joey, high-five for rolling bones!
(They high-five and howl, but Phoebe suddenly stops and the guys gasp and retreat in shock.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Pheebs, you’re leaking?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! You’re water broke!

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Well, don’t worry, I call shotgun! (She starts out the door.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Wait-wait!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs! We have to take you to the hospital now!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, Pheebs, the babies are coming now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: High-five, the babies are coming! (They all high-five.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, wait, remember when my water broke? (They all high-five again.)

content.description: The hallway between the apartments, they are taking Phoebe to the hospital but Chandler and Monica hold back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe Phoebe’s gonna have her babies!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, it’s beautiful. Amazing.
(They both kiss.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what else I can’t believe? I had to kiss Phoebe and Rachel every time I left a room, I mean it’s too bad they didn’t see us having sex.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you know anything about women?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s all right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (They kiss again.)
